leaf_cluster_name: 生信-组学整合与知识图谱生态
task_chain: 对齐→融合→推理→检索→证据链→评测

tools.name: NER-RE Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Spacy-based pipeline for Named Entity Recognition, Linking, and Relation Extraction
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive NLP pipeline built on Spacy v3 that performs Named Entity Recognition (NER), Entity Linking to a Knowledge Base, and Relation Extraction. It is designed to extract entities, normalize them, and identify relationships within text.

tools.name: OntoMerger
tools.one_line_profile: Ontology alignment library for deduplicating knowledge graph nodes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by AstraZeneca for ontology alignment and knowledge graph deduplication. It helps in merging overlapping concepts from different ontologies into a unified hierarchy, essential for maintaining clean biological knowledge graphs.

tools.name: argNorm
tools.one_line_profile: Antibiotic Resistance Gene (ARG) normalization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool to normalize Antibiotic Resistance Genes (ARGs) by mapping them to the Antibiotic Resistance Ontology (ARO). It supports outputs from various ARG prediction tools like DeepARG, ARGs-OAP, and Abricate.

tools.name: MedCAT
tools.one_line_profile: Medical Concept Annotation Tool for biomedical text
tools.detailed_description: A highly efficient Natural Language Processing tool for extracting, linking, and normalizing medical concepts from Electronic Health Records (EHRs) and biomedical text. It uses unsupervised learning to build concept databases and performs Named Entity Recognition and Linking (NER+L).

tools.name: MedCATtrainer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive interface for training and improving MedCAT models
tools.detailed_description: A web-based interface designed to inspect, improve, and add concepts to MedCAT models. It allows for active learning and manual annotation to create high-quality training datasets for biomedical Named Entity Recognition and Linking.

tools.name: CogStack NLP
tools.one_line_profile: NLP pipeline and platform for clinical data analysis
tools.detailed_description: The core NLP component of the CogStack platform, designed to process and analyze unstructured clinical data. It integrates tools like MedCAT to enable information extraction and enterprise-level clinical search and analytics.

tools.name: OXO
tools.one_line_profile: Ontology cross-reference and mapping service
tools.detailed_description: A service provided by EMBL-EBI for finding mappings (cross-references) between terms from different ontologies, vocabularies, and coding standards. It allows users to traverse the network of ontology mappings.

tools.name: OntoString
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for curating mappings from free text to ontology terms
tools.detailed_description: A curation tool developed by EMBL-EBI to assist in mapping free text descriptions to ontology terms, facilitating the standardization of biomedical data.

tools.name: ZOOMA
tools.one_line_profile: Optimal Ontology Mapping Application
tools.detailed_description: A service for automatically mapping free text annotations to ontology terms based on curated knowledge bases. Developed by EMBL-EBI, it helps in harmonizing biological data by predicting ontology codes for text descriptions.

tools.name: Bio-YODIE
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical named entity linking pipeline for GATE
tools.detailed_description: A biomedical Named Entity Linking (NEL) pipeline built on the GATE framework. It links entities in biomedical text to the UMLS (Unified Medical Language System) concepts, handling disambiguation and normalization.

tools.name: AGATHA
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Graph-mining And Transformer based Hypothesis generation Approach
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning system for hypothesis generation in biomedical knowledge graphs. It uses transformers and graph mining techniques to predict plausible connections and generate new scientific hypotheses from existing literature and data.

tools.name: CTakesParser.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package to parse Apache cTAKES output
tools.detailed_description: A utility library in Julia for parsing the XMI output generated by Apache cTAKES. It facilitates the integration of clinical text analysis results into Julia-based data analysis workflows.

tools.name: BERTMap
tools.one_line_profile: BERT-based ontology alignment system
tools.detailed_description: A system that utilizes BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) to perform ontology alignment. It leverages the semantic understanding of language models to match concepts across different ontologies.

tools.name: GeoSpatial-UNET
tools.one_line_profile: Vector map generation from aerial imagery using U-Net
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool based on U-Net architecture for extracting building footprints and generating vector maps from aerial or satellite imagery. It includes batch normalization enhancements for better segmentation performance.

tools.name: medaCy
tools.one_line_profile: Medical text mining and information extraction framework
tools.detailed_description: A medical text mining and information extraction library built on top of spaCy. It provides tools for training and deploying NER models specifically for clinical and biomedical text.

tools.name: UMLS-KG
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to build and query a Knowledge Graph from UMLS
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolset to construct a Knowledge Graph from UMLS (Unified Medical Language System) sources, load it into Neo4j, and perform queries and visualization. It integrates Scispacy for text processing.

tools.name: polymerNEN
tools.one_line_profile: Named Entity Normalization for polymers
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool for normalizing polymer named entities in materials science text. Developed by the Ramprasad Group, it maps diverse polymer names to standardized canonical forms.

tools.name: PALADIN
tools.one_line_profile: Protein alignment and detection interface for metagenomics
tools.detailed_description: PALADIN is a protein sequence alignment tool designed for the accurate and efficient detection of proteins in metagenomic shotgun sequencing data. It maps nucleotide reads to protein references.

tools.name: OntoEmma
tools.one_line_profile: Ontology matcher for matching entities between knowledge bases
tools.detailed_description: OntoEmma is a tool for matching entities between two ontologies or knowledge bases. It uses a neural network architecture to learn similarities between entities.

tools.name: scispacy
tools.one_line_profile: SpaCy pipeline and models for scientific/biomedical documents
tools.detailed_description: scispacy is a Python package containing spaCy pipelines and models for processing biomedical, scientific or clinical text, including features for NER and entity linking.

tools.name: Apache cTAKES
tools.one_line_profile: Natural Language Processing platform for clinical text
tools.detailed_description: Apache cTAKES (clinical Text Analysis and Knowledge Extraction System) is an NLP system for extracting information from electronic medical record clinical free-text.

tools.name: Map-On
tools.one_line_profile: Visual ontology mapping editor for R2RML documents
tools.detailed_description: Map-On is a web-based visual environment for ontology mapping, specifically designed to facilitate the creation of R2RML mappings for integrating data into knowledge graphs.

tools.name: RGI
tools.one_line_profile: Resistance Gene Identifier for predicting resistomes
tools.detailed_description: The Resistance Gene Identifier (RGI) is software to predict resistomes from protein or nucleotide data based on homology and SNP models, often used with the CARD database.

tools.name: BridgeDb
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for identifier mapping in bioinformatics
tools.detailed_description: BridgeDb is a framework and library for mapping identifiers between various biological databases (e.g., genes, proteins, metabolites) to support data integration.

tools.name: OMOP2OBO
tools.one_line_profile: Library for mapping OMOP terminologies to Open Biomedical Ontologies
tools.detailed_description: OMOP2OBO is a Python library designed to map OMOP standardized clinical terminologies to Open Biomedical Ontologies (OBO), facilitating interoperability between clinical and biomedical data.

tools.name: SapBERT
tools.one_line_profile: Self-alignment pretraining for biomedical entity linking
tools.detailed_description: SapBERT is a pretraining framework and model for biomedical entity linking, designed to align the representation space of biomedical entities using synonymy information.

tools.name: ontology-mapper
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for mapping free-text descriptions to ontology terms
tools.detailed_description: ontology-mapper is a tool developed by HMS for mapping free-text descriptions of entities to standard ontology terms, supporting data harmonization.

tools.name: Prancer
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for rapid annotation for clinical entity recognition
tools.detailed_description: Prancer is a platform designed to enable rapid annotation for clinical entity recognition, facilitating the creation of training data for NLP models.

tools.name: DBpedia Mappings Autogeneration
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to infer Wikipedia infobox to ontology mappings for DBpedia
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts and tools designed to automatically generate and infer mappings between Wikipedia infobox attributes and the DBpedia ontology, facilitating knowledge graph construction.

tools.name: Wikidata Mapper
tools.one_line_profile: Automated tool for mapping Wikidata entities to DBpedia ontology
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed for the automated generation of mappings from Wikidata properties and classes to the DBpedia ontology, supporting knowledge graph alignment.

tools.name: ckblib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for creating clinical knowledge graphs from biomedical literature
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit that integrates NCBI Eutils, cTAKES annotators, and Neo4J to extract clinical information from literature and construct knowledge graphs.

tools.name: gficf
tools.one_line_profile: Gene Frequency - Inverse Cell Frequency normalization for single cell data
tools.detailed_description: An R implementation (via C++) of the TF-IDF analogous normalization method specifically designed for single-cell gene expression data.

tools.name: ANGEL
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical generative entity linking with negative sampling
tools.detailed_description: A tool for biomedical entity linking that employs a generative approach and learns from negative samples to improve disambiguation accuracy.

tools.name: BERN2
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced neural biomedical named entity recognition and normalization tool
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art neural tool for recognizing and normalizing various biomedical entities (genes, diseases, chemicals, etc.) from text.

tools.name: BioSyn
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical entity representations with synonym marginalization
tools.detailed_description: A model and tool for biomedical entity normalization that leverages synonym marginalization to learn robust entity representations.

tools.name: KAZU-NER-module
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical NER module integrating BERN2 and Kazu framework
tools.detailed_description: A component for enterprise-grade biomedical named entity recognition, distilling the capabilities of BERN2 within the Kazu framework.

tools.name: BERN
tools.one_line_profile: Neural named entity recognition and multi-type normalization tool
tools.detailed_description: A neural network-based tool for biomedical named entity recognition and normalization, capable of handling multiple entity types.

tools.name: Generate-and-Rank-ConNorm
tools.one_line_profile: Generate-and-Rank framework for biomedical concept normalization
tools.detailed_description: A framework utilizing semantic type regularization to perform biomedical concept normalization through a generate-and-rank approach.

tools.name: EDAMmap
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for mapping text input to EDAM ontology concepts
tools.detailed_description: A utility to map various textual inputs to concepts within the EDAM ontology, useful for annotating bioinformatics resources.

tools.name: BridgeDbR
tools.one_line_profile: R package interface for BridgeDb identifier mapping framework
tools.detailed_description: The Bioconductor R package that provides an interface to the BridgeDb framework for mapping identifiers between various biological databases.

tools.name: create-bridgedb-metabolites
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to create BridgeDb mapping files for metabolites
tools.detailed_description: A utility to generate BridgeDb identity mapping databases specifically for metabolites, aggregating data from HMDB, ChEBI, and Wikidata.

tools.name: LogMap Matcher
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable ontology alignment and repair system
tools.detailed_description: A highly scalable system for ontology alignment (matching) and alignment repair, capable of handling large biomedical ontologies.

tools.name: RNAnorm
tools.one_line_profile: Normalization library for RNA-seq gene expression data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing standard normalization methods (TPM, CPM, etc.) for RNA-seq gene expression data.

tools.name: cTAKES Clinical Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Engine for executing clinical NLP pipelines using Apache cTAKES
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline engine designed to facilitate the configuration and execution of Apache cTAKES clinical text processing workflows.

tools.name: PubTator Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities to retrieve and process PubTator annotations
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts and tools to access, download, and process biomedical text annotations from the PubTator service.

tools.name: Gilda
tools.one_line_profile: Grounding of biomedical named entities with contextual disambiguation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package and service for normalizing (grounding) biomedical named entities to knowledge bases, featuring context-aware disambiguation.

tools.name: xMEN
tools.one_line_profile: Modular toolkit for cross-lingual medical entity normalization
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit designed for normalizing medical entities across different languages, supporting various knowledge bases.

tools.name: HUNER
tools.one_line_profile: Named Entity Recognition tool for biomedical entities
tools.detailed_description: A tool focused on biomedical named entity recognition, providing models and inference capabilities for extracting entities from text.

tools.name: Drug ID Mapping
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for cross-matching drug identifiers across multiple databases
tools.detailed_description: A utility to map and unify drug identifiers from databases like DrugBank, ChEMBL, PubChem, and UMLS into a structured format.

tools.name: UPIMAPI
tools.one_line_profile: UniProt ID mapping tool via API
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to perform identifier mapping using the UniProt API, supporting batch processing and various cross-references.

tools.name: OntologyRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for biomedical code mapping
tools.detailed_description: A tool leveraging RAG and Large Language Models to improve the accuracy and speed of mapping biomedical text to ontology codes.

tools.name: biotext
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to download and chunk biomedical literature
tools.detailed_description: A utility for downloading, processing, and chunking large collections of biomedical literature (like PubMed/PMC) for local analysis.

tools.name: clinspacy
tools.one_line_profile: Clinical Natural Language Processing wrapper for spaCy in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package that performs clinical natural language processing (NLP) by wrapping spaCy, scispacy, and medspacy, enabling entity recognition and normalization in clinical text.

tools.name: AIONER
tools.one_line_profile: All-in-One Named Entity Recognition tool by NCBI
tools.detailed_description: A biomedical named entity recognition tool developed by NCBI, designed to identify various biomedical entities in text.

tools.name: semantic-bot
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-automatic tool for generating RDF mappings
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to assist in generating RDF mappings for datasets, facilitating the semantic enrichment of data.

tools.name: mapping-master
tools.one_line_profile: DSL library for mapping spreadsheets to OWL ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A library supporting the Mapping Master DSL, allowing users to map content from spreadsheets to OWL ontologies, part of the Protégé ecosystem.

tools.name: ChemSpot
tools.one_line_profile: Named entity recognition tool for chemicals
tools.detailed_description: A named entity recognition tool for identifying mentions of chemicals in natural language texts, including drugs, abbreviations, and molecular formulas.

tools.name: geniatagger
tools.one_line_profile: POS tagging and NER tool for biomedical text
tools.detailed_description: A tool for part-of-speech tagging, shallow parsing, and named entity recognition specifically designed for biomedical text.

tools.name: OntoAligner
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for ontology alignment
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed to facilitate ontology alignment tasks, providing utilities for matching and mapping between different ontologies.

tools.name: MedType
tools.one_line_profile: Medical entity linking tool with semantic type prediction
tools.detailed_description: A biomedical entity linking framework that improves accuracy by predicting the semantic type of entities before linking them to the knowledge base, specifically targeting the UMLS metathesaurus.

tools.name: OHDSI Ananke
tools.one_line_profile: Mapping tool for OHDSI and UMLS identifiers
tools.detailed_description: An R package developed to facilitate the mapping and alignment between OHDSI Concept Identifiers and Unified Medical Language System (UMLS) identifiers, supporting interoperability in observational health data.

tools.name: Biomedical-Entity-Linking (AAAI21)
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight neural model for biomedical entity linking
tools.detailed_description: A Keras-based implementation of a lightweight neural architecture for biomedical entity linking, designed to efficiently map mentions to knowledge base entities as presented at AAAI 2021.

tools.name: CollaboNet
tools.one_line_profile: Collaborative network for biomedical named entity recognition
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework for biomedical named entity recognition (NER) that utilizes collaborative learning strategies to improve the extraction of biomedical entities from text.

tools.name: Multi-BioNER
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-type biomedical NER with deep multi-task learning
tools.detailed_description: A deep multi-task learning model for biomedical named entity recognition that leverages cross-type information to enhance the identification of multiple biomedical entity categories simultaneously.

tools.name: Grid Map
tools.one_line_profile: Universal grid map library for mobile robotic mapping and terrain modeling
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for managing two-dimensional grid maps with multiple data layers, commonly used in mobile robotics for terrain mapping, elevation modeling, and navigation.

tools.name: Blue Brain Nexus
tools.one_line_profile: Data and knowledge graph management platform for data-driven science
tools.detailed_description: A provenance-based, semantic data management platform that enables scientists to build, store, query, and share knowledge graphs, specifically designed for data-driven science like neuroscience.

tools.name: Genesis
tools.one_line_profile: Generative world platform for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI
tools.detailed_description: A physics-based simulation platform designed for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI learning, enabling the generation of diverse environments and scenarios for training agents.

tools.name: KG-COVID-19
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for producing a COVID-19 knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: A framework and pipeline instance from the KG-Hub ecosystem designed to ingest, transform, and merge various biomedical datasets into a structured knowledge graph specifically for COVID-19 research.

tools.name: kg-obo
tools.one_line_profile: ETL tool to transform OBO ontologies into KGX format
tools.detailed_description: A utility package within the KG-Hub ecosystem that transforms OBO (Open Biological and Biomedical Ontology) ontologies into KGX TSV format and OBO JSON, facilitating their integration into knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Clinical Knowledge Graph (CKG)
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for biomedical data integration and automated knowledge discovery
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform that integrates experimental proteomics data with diverse biomedical databases into a graph database, enabling automated analysis, knowledge discovery, and report generation for clinical proteomics.

tools.name: Halyard
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RDF triplestore based on HBase
tools.detailed_description: A horizontally scalable RDF triplestore built on top of Apache HBase, designed for the integration and SPARQL querying of extremely large semantic data models and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Isaac GR00T
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for generalist robot learning
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model designed for generalist robots, enabling them to understand multimodal instructions and perform tasks in simulation and real-world environments, facilitating embodied AI research.

tools.name: KAG
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Augmented Generation framework for logical reasoning and retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A framework combining knowledge graphs (OpenSPG) and LLMs to perform logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval, addressing limitations of vector-based RAG in professional domain knowledge bases.

tools.name: Drake
tools.one_line_profile: Model-based design and verification library for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ toolbox for analyzing the dynamics of robots and building control systems, with a heavy emphasis on optimization-based design and verification.

tools.name: Schematic
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical data model and metadata management package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for managing biomedical data models and metadata ingress, facilitating the validation and submission of data to platforms like Synapse, often used in large-scale consortiums.

tools.name: GCN-SC
tools.one_line_profile: Graph convolutional network framework for single-cell multi-omics integration
tools.detailed_description: A universal framework utilizing graph convolutional networks to integrate single-cell multi-omics data, facilitating downstream analysis like clustering and cell type identification.

tools.name: MOCO-GCN
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-omics data integration using Co-training Graph Convolutional Networks
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning method for multi-omics integration that employs Two-view Co-training GCNs and a View Correlation Discovery Network to learn features and integrate data for cancer subtype classification.

tools.name: biotoolsSchema
tools.one_line_profile: Data model and schema for describing computational tools in life sciences
tools.detailed_description: The official XML and JSON schema definitions for bio.tools, providing a standardized data model to describe software, databases, and services in bioinformatics.

tools.name: BioChatter
tools.one_line_profile: Backend library for conversational AI in biomedicine
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to orchestrate the interaction between Large Language Models (LLMs) and biomedical data/knowledge graphs, facilitating the creation of conversational AI applications for research.

tools.name: BioCypher
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for creating biomedical knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A framework that streamlines the creation of biomedical knowledge graphs by providing a modular system to map, transform, and load data from various sources into graph databases, ensuring interoperability and reproducibility.

tools.name: patient-kg
tools.one_line_profile: BioCypher pipeline for clinical patient data knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A specific implementation of the BioCypher framework designed to ingest and structure clinical patient data (using standards like ICD10, SNOMED CT) into a knowledge graph for analysis.

tools.name: Biolink Model
tools.one_line_profile: High-level data model for biological entities and relationships
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive data model that defines a standard hierarchy of biomedical entities (genes, diseases, chemicals) and their relationships, serving as the schema for many biomedical knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Biolink Model Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for working with the Biolink Model
tools.detailed_description: A utility library providing functions to programmatically access, traverse, and validate data against the Biolink Model schema.

tools.name: KGX
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph Exchange utility
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line tool for exchanging knowledge graphs in various formats (RDF, TSV, JSON-LD) and validating them against the Biolink Model.

tools.name: Biomappings
tools.one_line_profile: Curated mappings between biological entities and Python access tools
tools.detailed_description: A community-curated repository of mappings between biomedical identifiers (e.g., different ontologies) that are missing from primary sources, including a Python package to access and utilize these mappings.

tools.name: Bioregistry
tools.one_line_profile: Integrative registry of biological databases and ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive registry and Python library for resolving, normalizing, and accessing metadata about biological databases, ontologies, and nomenclatures.

tools.name: PyOBO
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for handling OBO ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for loading, parsing, and interacting with biomedical ontologies and terminologies, specifically focusing on OBO formats and identifier mapping.

tools.name: GTSAM
tools.one_line_profile: Library for smoothing and mapping using factor graphs
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library (with Python wrappers) implementing smoothing and mapping (SAM) techniques for robotics and computer vision, utilizing factor graphs and Bayes networks for optimization.

tools.name: Bullet Physics SDK
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time collision detection and multi-physics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A professional open-source physics engine for simulating rigid body dynamics, soft body dynamics, and collision detection, widely used in robotics simulation and VR.

tools.name: PheKnowLator
tools.one_line_profile: Heterogeneous biomedical knowledge graph construction
tools.detailed_description: A Python ecosystem for constructing heterogeneous biomedical knowledge graphs from various ontologies and data sources, supporting alternative semantic models.

tools.name: CHOP Data Models
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical data models in parseable formats
tools.detailed_description: A collection of data models for biomedical research (e.g., clinical, genomic) provided in machine-readable formats to facilitate standardization and interoperability.

tools.name: DocumentGraph
tools.one_line_profile: ETL pipeline for extracting text to Neo4j knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides an ETL pipeline to extract, process, and structure text from documents into a Neo4j knowledge graph, facilitating unstructured data integration.

tools.name: semantic-pydantic
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic annotation for Pydantic models using Bioregistry
tools.detailed_description: A library to annotate Pydantic data models and FastAPI endpoints with semantic metadata from the Bioregistry, enhancing FAIRness of biomedical data services.

tools.name: Webots
tools.one_line_profile: Open source robot simulator
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive robot simulator that provides a complete development environment to model, program, and simulate robots, widely used in robotics research and education.

tools.name: BindingDB Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts to process BindingDB for Hetionet
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts to process and transform data from BindingDB (drug-target binding affinities) into a format suitable for integration into heterogeneous networks like Hetionet.

tools.name: Disease Ontology Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Extensions and processing for Disease Ontology
tools.detailed_description: Scripts and resources to process the Disease Ontology (DO), creating user-friendly extensions and slim versions for integration into biomedical knowledge graphs.

tools.name: DisGeNET Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Processing DisGeNET for Hetionet integration
tools.detailed_description: Pipelines to process the DisGeNET database of gene-disease associations, filtering and formatting the data for inclusion in the Hetionet knowledge graph.

tools.name: Hetionet Integrator
tools.one_line_profile: Integration scripts for Hetionet v1.0
tools.detailed_description: The core integration scripts and resources used to construct Hetionet v1.0, a heterogeneous network designed for drug repurposing, combining data from multiple biomedical sources.

tools.name: MeSH Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Processing and extending MeSH vocabulary
tools.detailed_description: Tools to process the Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) vocabulary, creating user-friendly formats and hierarchies for use in biomedical data integration and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: DORA
tools.one_line_profile: Dataflow-Oriented Robotic Architecture middleware
tools.detailed_description: A middleware designed to simplify the creation of AI-based robotic applications using a low-latency, distributed dataflow architecture, allowing applications to be modeled as directed graphs.

tools.name: GLUE
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-linked unified embedding for single-cell multi-omics integration
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework designed to integrate unpaired single-cell multi-omics data (e.g., scRNA-seq and scATAC-seq) by learning a joint embedding graph and aligning regulatory interactions.

tools.name: GraphOmics
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive dashboard for exploring and integrating multi-omics data
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for the interactive exploration and integration of transcriptomics, proteomics, and metabolomics data, allowing users to visualize relationships and map data onto biological pathways.

tools.name: grinn
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database and R package for omics data integration
tools.detailed_description: A software platform that combines a graph database (Neo4j) with an R package to facilitate the integration, management, and analysis of multi-omics data, reconstructing relationships between metabolites, genes, and proteins.

tools.name: prefixmaps
tools.one_line_profile: Library for managing semantic prefix maps and CURIEs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and registry for resolving semantic prefixes (CURIEs) to IRIs, essential for Knowledge Graph construction, data normalization, and interoperability in biomedical ontologies.

tools.name: PrimeKG
tools.one_line_profile: Precision Medicine Knowledge Graph construction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: The codebase for generating PrimeKG, a comprehensive multimodal knowledge graph designed for precision medicine that integrates data from various biomedical databases to support disease-drug-gene analysis.

tools.name: monarch-ingest
tools.one_line_profile: ETL pipeline for the Monarch Initiative Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: The data ingestion and transformation system for the Monarch Initiative, utilizing Koza to convert diverse biological data sources into a unified Knowledge Graph structure for phenotype-genotype analysis.

tools.name: monarchr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for Monarch Initiative Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to facilitate the retrieval, manipulation, and analysis of data from the Monarch Initiative Knowledge Graph and other KGX-formatted graphs.

tools.name: Morph-KGC
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RML-based Knowledge Graph generation engine
tools.detailed_description: A powerful engine that constructs RDF knowledge graphs from heterogeneous data sources (such as relational databases and tabular files) using RML (RDF Mapping Language) mappings, optimized for performance.

tools.name: Disease_ontologies_for_knowledge_graphs
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge base solution for integrating disease ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A knowledge base solution that utilizes Grakn core and disease ontology cross-references to facilitate easy switching between ontology hierarchies for data integration purposes in biomedical knowledge graphs.

tools.name: LLM Graph Builder
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for constructing knowledge graphs from unstructured data using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Neo4j-based tool that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to extract entities and relationships from unstructured text data, automating the construction of knowledge graphs.

tools.name: OntoWeaver
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of heterogeneous data into Semantic Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate the integration of heterogeneous iterable data (such as tabular data) into Semantic Knowledge Graph databases by mapping data to ontologies.

tools.name: Open Semantic Search
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated search engine and text mining platform with KG support
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform combining a search engine with text mining and analytics capabilities. It includes ETL pipelines for document processing, OCR, Named Entity Recognition (NER), and integration with knowledge graphs and ontologies.

tools.name: PyBEL
tools.one_line_profile: Python ecosystem for Biological Expression Language (BEL)
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python software ecosystem for parsing, validating, compiling, and converting networks encoded in the Biological Expression Language (BEL), facilitating the handling of biological knowledge graphs.

tools.name: MOGONET
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Omics Graph Convolutional Networks for biomedical classification
tools.detailed_description: A framework for multi-omics data integrative analysis using Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) for classification tasks in biomedical applications, such as cancer subtype identification.

tools.name: Unipop
tools.one_line_profile: Data Integration Graph virtualization engine
tools.detailed_description: A data federation and virtualization engine that allows querying various non-graph data sources (like Elasticsearch, JDBC) as a virtual graph, facilitating data integration for knowledge graphs.

tools.name: UBKG-ETL
tools.one_line_profile: ETL framework for Unified Biomedical Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: A framework developed by the HuBMAP consortium to combine data from UMLS and other sources into a set of CSV files for importing into Neo4j to build a Unified Biomedical Knowledge Graph (UBKG).

tools.name: Docs2KG
tools.one_line_profile: Unified Knowledge Graph Construction from Heterogeneous Documents
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to extract and construct knowledge graphs from heterogeneous documents (PDF, Markdown, etc.) using a Human-LLM collaborative approach, facilitating scientific knowledge management.

tools.name: LSQ
tools.one_line_profile: Linked SPARQL Queries framework for RDF log analysis and benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: A framework for RDFizing triple store logs and performing SPARQL query extraction, analysis, and benchmarking, useful for optimizing scientific semantic web endpoints.

tools.name: BioDWH2
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based data warehouse and mapping tool for bioinformatics
tools.detailed_description: An automated, graph-based data warehouse and mapping tool designed to integrate various bioinformatics and medical informatics data sources into a unified knowledge graph.

tools.name: Virtuoso (CMU-SAFARI)
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for virtual memory research
tools.detailed_description: A fast, accurate, and versatile simulation framework designed for virtual memory research, modeling diverse VM designs and estimating OS overheads.

tools.name: CiteGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Citation graph web visualizer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for visualizing citation graphs, useful for scientometrics and analyzing research impact networks.

tools.name: VerilogA-Wave-Generator
tools.one_line_profile: VerilogA code generator for Spectre simulation waveforms
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate VerilogA code for creating specific waveforms in Spectre simulations, facilitating electronic design automation and circuit physics simulation.

tools.name: tripper
tools.one_line_profile: Triplestore wrapper for materials science data
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper package for triplestores, developed by the European Materials Modelling Council (EMMC) to facilitate materials science data management and knowledge graph interaction.

tools.name: Seq2KG
tools.one_line_profile: Neural model for knowledge graph construction from text
tools.detailed_description: A neural model designed to construct knowledge graphs directly from text sequences, facilitating the extraction of entities and relations for KG population.

tools.name: Neo4j-KGBuilder
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge graph construction and visualization platform based on Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive system integrating Neo4j, SpringBoot, Vue, and D3.js to facilitate the construction, management, and visualization of knowledge graphs.

tools.name: AMG-RAG
tools.one_line_profile: Agentic Medical Graph-RAG framework
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework that automates the construction and continuous updating of Medical Knowledge Graphs (MKGs), integrates reasoning, and retrieves external evidence for medical QA.

tools.name: GraphDB Workbench
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based administration and visualization tool for GraphDB
tools.detailed_description: The web application interface for GraphDB, allowing users to manage repositories, execute SPARQL queries, and visualize RDF data.

tools.name: Harvester
tools.one_line_profile: OAI-PMH harvester transforming metadata to RDF
tools.detailed_description: An XForms-based tool that harvests metadata via OAI-PMH, transforms it into RDF format, and posts it into a triplestore for access.

tools.name: ControlledVocabularyManager
tools.one_line_profile: RDF-based controlled vocabulary management system
tools.detailed_description: A Rails application utilizing Blazegraph to manage controlled vocabularies in RDF format, facilitating ontology management and semantic interoperability.

tools.name: scGCN
tools.one_line_profile: Graph convolutional networks for single cell omics knowledge transfer
tools.detailed_description: A graph convolutional network algorithm designed for knowledge transfer in single-cell omics data analysis, enabling label transfer and integration.

tools.name: PloverDB
tools.one_line_profile: In-memory database service for biomedical knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: An in-memory database service designed to host and serve biomedical knowledge graphs via TRAPI APIs, optimized for performance.

tools.name: RecallGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Versioning data store for time-variant graph data
tools.detailed_description: A graph database solution that supports versioning, allowing for the storage and retrieval of time-variant graph data.

tools.name: RedisGraph
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance in-memory graph database
tools.detailed_description: A graph database implemented as a Redis module, leveraging sparse matrices and linear algebra for efficient graph operations.

tools.name: qstore
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance RDF Quadstore in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A barebones, high-performance RDF Quadstore written in Rust, providing interoperability bindings for Python RDFLib.

tools.name: SANSA-Stack
tools.one_line_profile: Big Data RDF Processing and Analytics Stack
tools.detailed_description: A stack built on Apache Spark and Apache Jena for scalable processing, querying, and analysis of large-scale RDF data.

tools.name: DeTrusty
tools.one_line_profile: Federated Query Engine over RDF Sources
tools.detailed_description: A federated query engine capable of executing queries across multiple RDF sources, enabling integrated data access.

tools.name: Ontario
tools.one_line_profile: Federated SPARQL Query Processing Engine
tools.detailed_description: A federated SPARQL query processing engine designed for semantic data lakes, optimizing query execution over distributed sources.

tools.name: SDM-RDFizer
tools.one_line_profile: RML-Compliant Engine for Knowledge Graph Construction
tools.detailed_description: An efficient engine for constructing knowledge graphs from heterogeneous data sources using the RML mapping language.

tools.name: GraphoPlex
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed graph database engine
tools.detailed_description: A distributed graph database engine that includes a supported query language for managing and querying graph data.

tools.name: BioKEEN
tools.one_line_profile: Library for learning biological knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A computational library designed for learning and evaluating embeddings specifically for biological knowledge graphs.

tools.name: knowledge-engine-SPARQL-endpoint
tools.one_line_profile: SPARQL endpoint for Knowledge Engine
tools.detailed_description: An endpoint implementation that handles SPARQL queries and executes them on the Knowledge Engine infrastructure.

tools.name: SHACL API
tools.one_line_profile: Java API for SHACL based on Apache Jena
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) API using Apache Jena, used for validating RDF graphs against a set of conditions.

tools.name: Awesome-Text2GQL
tools.one_line_profile: Fine-tuning dataset auto-generation for Graph Query Languages
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatically generating fine-tuning datasets to train models for converting text to Graph Query Languages (GQL).

tools.name: RaiseWikibase
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for fast inserts into Wikibase instances
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to facilitate knowledge graph construction by enabling fast data insertion into Wikibase instances.

tools.name: VaLiK
tools.one_line_profile: Annotation-free multimodal knowledge graph construction
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Aligning Vision to Language' for constructing multimodal knowledge graphs without annotations to enhance LLM reasoning.

tools.name: G6VP
tools.one_line_profile: Graph visualization and analysis platform
tools.detailed_description: G6VP is an online visual analysis tool for graphs and a low-code platform for building graph applications. It supports large-scale graph rendering, interactive exploration, and visual analysis, which are essential for interpreting complex knowledge graphs in scientific research.

tools.name: Apache AGE
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database extension for PostgreSQL
tools.detailed_description: Apache AGE is a PostgreSQL extension that provides graph database functionality. It enables users to store and analyze graph data (nodes and edges) alongside relational data, supporting the openCypher query language for complex graph queries and analysis.

tools.name: Apache AGE Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization tool for Apache AGE
tools.detailed_description: Apache AGE Viewer is a user interface and visualization tool designed specifically for Apache AGE. It allows researchers to execute queries and visualize graph data stored in PostgreSQL, facilitating the exploration of relationships and structures in scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: HugeGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable distributed graph database
tools.detailed_description: HugeGraph is a fast, highly scalable, distributed graph database designed to store and query massive graph data (billions of vertices and edges). It supports the Apache TinkerPop Gremlin query language and is suitable for managing large-scale scientific knowledge graphs and biological networks.

tools.name: Apache Jena
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Semantic Web and Linked Data applications
tools.detailed_description: Apache Jena is an open-source Java framework for building Semantic Web and Linked Data applications. It provides a comprehensive API for RDF data processing, a SPARQL query engine (ARQ), and an inference engine for reasoning over ontologies (OWL/RDFS), making it a foundational tool for bioinformatics knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Apache TinkerPop
tools.one_line_profile: Graph computing framework
tools.detailed_description: Apache TinkerPop is a graph computing framework that provides a standard interface (Gremlin) for graph databases (OLTP) and graph analytic systems (OLAP). It enables researchers to write complex graph traversals and algorithms that are portable across different graph systems.

tools.name: ArangoDB
tools.one_line_profile: Native multi-model database for graph, document, and key-value data
tools.detailed_description: ArangoDB is a native multi-model database that supports graph, document, and key-value data models within a single engine. It provides a powerful query language (AQL) and built-in graph algorithms, making it highly effective for storing and analyzing heterogeneous scientific data and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: ArangoPipe
tools.one_line_profile: Metadata layer for machine learning pipelines on ArangoDB
tools.detailed_description: ArangoPipe is a tool for managing machine learning metadata and pipelines. It allows researchers to capture, store, and analyze model parameters, performance metrics, and dataset information within a structured knowledge graph in ArangoDB, facilitating experiment tracking and reproducibility in scientific ML.

tools.name: FastGraphML
tools.one_line_profile: Graph embeddings library for ArangoDB
tools.detailed_description: FastGraphML is a low-code framework that integrates ArangoDB with PyTorch Geometric (PyG). It enables researchers to easily generate graph embeddings and perform graph neural network (GNN) analysis directly on data stored in ArangoDB, streamlining the workflow from graph storage to ML inference.

tools.name: Bio4j
tools.one_line_profile: Bioinformatics graph data platform mapping UniProt, GO, and other datasets to a graph model
tools.detailed_description: Bio4j is a bioinformatics graph database and domain model that integrates data from UniProt, Gene Ontology (GO), NCBI Taxonomy, and Expasy Enzyme into a unified graph structure, enabling complex biological queries.

tools.name: Blazegraph
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance graph database supporting RDF/SPARQL and Tinkerpop
tools.detailed_description: Blazegraph is a scalable, high-performance graph database widely used in scientific applications (e.g., Wikidata, Semantic Web) for storing and querying large-scale RDF triples and property graphs.

tools.name: BioKG
tools.one_line_profile: A Knowledge Graph for Relational Learning On Biological Data
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark dataset and Python library designed for relational learning on biological knowledge graphs. It integrates data from multiple biomedical databases to support tasks like link prediction and knowledge graph embedding in the biological domain.

tools.name: automatic-KG-creation-with-LLM
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Ontology and Knowledge Graph construction with LLM
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for automating the construction of ontologies and knowledge graphs from unstructured text using Large Language Models (LLMs). It leverages LLMs to extract entities and relations, facilitating the creation of structured scientific knowledge bases.

tools.name: SemTK
tools.one_line_profile: Semantics Toolkit for SPARQL query generation and data ingestion
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to simplify the interaction with SPARQL endpoints (specifically Virtuoso) through a drag-and-drop interface for query generation and data ingestion, facilitating the management of semantic knowledge graphs.

tools.name: InteractiveGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based interactive visualization framework for large graph data
tools.detailed_description: A framework for interactive visualization and analysis of large graph data, supporting data from GSON files or Neo4j databases, enabling researchers to explore complex relationships in knowledge graphs.

tools.name: PyGraphistry
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated library for big graph visualization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that interfaces with the Graphistry visual graph analyzer to load, shape, embed, and explore large graphs using GPU acceleration, suitable for analyzing complex scientific networks.

tools.name: HyperGraphQL
tools.one_line_profile: GraphQL interface for querying and serving linked data
tools.detailed_description: A middleware service that provides a GraphQL interface for querying and serving linked data (RDF) from various SPARQL endpoints, facilitating the integration of semantic web data into modern applications.

tools.name: Hypergraph-DB
tools.one_line_profile: Hypergraph Database with visualization capabilities
tools.detailed_description: A database system designed for storing and visualizing hypergraphs, which are essential for representing complex many-to-many relationships in scientific data such as biological networks.

tools.name: rdf_fdw
tools.one_line_profile: PostgreSQL Foreign Data Wrapper for RDF Triplestores
tools.detailed_description: A PostgreSQL extension that allows SQL queries to access data stored in RDF triplestores (SPARQL endpoints), enabling data integration between relational and semantic scientific databases.

tools.name: Kùzu
tools.one_line_profile: Embedded property graph database optimized for query speed and interoperability
tools.detailed_description: An embedded property graph database management system built for high-performance query processing. It integrates vector search and full-text search, implements the Cypher query language, and is designed to serve as a storage backend for knowledge graphs and graph analytics in scientific applications.

tools.name: Pixy
tools.one_line_profile: Declarative vendor-independent graph query language on TinkerPop
tools.detailed_description: A declarative graph query language built on top of the TinkerPop software stack. It provides a vendor-independent way to query graph databases, facilitating the abstraction of graph query logic in knowledge graph applications.

tools.name: G-CORE Spark
tools.one_line_profile: Reference implementation of the G-CORE graph query language on Spark
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the G-CORE graph query language, developed by the Linked Data Benchmark Council (LDBC), running on Apache Spark. It serves as a research tool for evaluating and utilizing advanced graph query features like path property graphs and composable graph queries.

tools.name: LinkML-Store
tools.one_line_profile: Storage wrapper for LinkML data models
tools.detailed_description: A library that provides a unified interface for storing and retrieving data conforming to LinkML (Linked Data Modeling Language) schemas. It supports multiple backends, facilitating the management of scientific data models and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: LiteGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight graph database with vector and relational support
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight graph database designed for knowledge persistence and retrieval in AI applications. It supports relational data, vector embeddings, and integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP), making it suitable for hybrid AI/KG workflows.

tools.name: RDFSharp
tools.one_line_profile: .NET library for Semantic Web applications (RDF, SPARQL, SHACL)
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight .NET library for building Semantic Web applications. It provides comprehensive support for RDF data modeling, SPARQL querying, and SHACL validation, enabling the development of knowledge graph applications in the .NET ecosystem.

tools.name: openCypherTranspiler
tools.one_line_profile: Transpiler from openCypher to SQL
tools.detailed_description: A tool that transpiles openCypher graph query language into T-SQL (and potentially other relational query languages). It allows researchers to execute graph queries on top of existing relational database infrastructure, facilitating graph analysis on relational data.

tools.name: NebulaGraph-Bench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for NebulaGraph
tools.detailed_description: A collection of benchmark services and tools designed to evaluate the performance of NebulaGraph. It supports standard graph benchmarks (like LDBC) to assess query latency and throughput in large-scale graph scenarios.

tools.name: nebula-pyg
tools.one_line_profile: Connector between NebulaGraph and PyTorch Geometric
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the integration of NebulaGraph with PyTorch Geometric (PyG). It enables the loading of graph data stored in NebulaGraph directly into PyG datasets for training Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in scientific AI workflows.

tools.name: NebulaGraph Lite
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight, pip-installable distribution of NebulaGraph
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight distribution of NebulaGraph that can be installed via pip. It is designed for quick setup in data science environments (like Colab or Jupyter Notebooks) to facilitate ad-hoc graph analysis and prototyping without complex deployment.

tools.name: biochem4j
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated biochemical knowledge graph builder
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and framework for generating, integrating, and querying biochemical knowledge graphs (including metabolic pathways and chemical structures) using Neo4j.

tools.name: gfe-db
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database for HLA sequence data
tools.detailed_description: A graph database implementation and workflow for representing IPD-IMGT/HLA sequence data using the Gene Feature Enumeration (GFE) model for immunogenetics research.

tools.name: BioNetDB
tools.one_line_profile: Storage engine for biological networks
tools.detailed_description: A storage engine and query interface designed to work with biological networks and systems biology data using a NoSQL graph database approach.

tools.name: BioRuby-RDF
tools.one_line_profile: RDF plugin for BioRuby
tools.detailed_description: A BioRuby plugin for parsing, filtering, and interacting with biological data in RDF format, facilitating integration with triple-stores.

tools.name: SPARQL-DL API
tools.one_line_profile: Query engine for SPARQL-DL to query OWL-DL ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A query engine implementation for SPARQL-DL, allowing users to execute SPARQL queries over OWL-DL ontologies, bridging the gap between Semantic Web standards and Description Logic reasoners.

tools.name: qKnow
tools.one_line_profile: Enterprise-grade knowledge graph platform for construction and fusion
tools.detailed_description: An open-source knowledge graph platform providing capabilities for knowledge extraction, fusion, graph construction, and visualization, designed to build structured and queryable knowledge systems.

tools.name: Quadstore
tools.one_line_profile: LevelDB-backed graph database for JS runtimes
tools.detailed_description: A graph database backed by LevelDB that runs in Node.js, Deno, and browsers, supporting SPARQL queries and the RDF/JS interface for managing linked data.

tools.name: Mulgara
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RDF Triple Store written in Java
tools.detailed_description: A scalable RDF Triple Store and database written in Java, designed for storing and querying large sets of RDF data using SPARQL and TQL.

tools.name: RageDB
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance in-memory property graph database
tools.detailed_description: An in-memory property graph database server using a shared-nothing architecture, designed for high-performance graph traversals and queries.

tools.name: Ostrich
tools.one_line_profile: Versioned RDF triple store supporting changesets
tools.detailed_description: A versioned RDF triple store (OffSet-enabled TRIple store for CHangesets) that allows efficient storage and querying of multiple versions of a dataset.

tools.name: Sage
tools.one_line_profile: SPARQL query engine for public Linked Data with preemption
tools.detailed_description: A SPARQL query engine designed for public Linked Data providers, supporting preemptive query execution to ensure server stability and responsiveness.

tools.name: Semagrow
tools.one_line_profile: Federated SPARQL query engine
tools.detailed_description: A SPARQL query federator that integrates heterogeneous data sources, allowing unified querying across distributed knowledge graphs.

tools.name: AgensGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Transactional graph database based on PostgreSQL
tools.detailed_description: AgensGraph is a multi-model graph database based on PostgreSQL that supports both property graph and relational data models, enabling complex graph data storage and querying for knowledge graph applications.

tools.name: SociaLite
tools.one_line_profile: Query language for large-scale graph analysis and data mining
tools.detailed_description: SociaLite is a Datalog-based query language designed for efficient large-scale graph analysis and data mining, allowing concise expression of graph algorithms.

tools.name: sones GraphDB
tools.one_line_profile: Open source object-oriented graph database
tools.detailed_description: sones GraphDB is an object-oriented graph database designed to store highly connected data, suitable for knowledge graph applications.

tools.name: SPARQL-Generate
tools.one_line_profile: Extension of SPARQL 1.1 to generate RDF from heterogeneous documents
tools.detailed_description: SPARQL-Generate is an implementation over Apache Jena that extends SPARQL 1.1 to query and transform non-RDF documents (JSON, XML, CSV, etc.) into RDF graphs, facilitating data integration for knowledge graphs.

tools.name: GraphQuery
tools.one_line_profile: Query language and execution engine for graph data
tools.detailed_description: GraphQuery is a query language and execution engine designed to query data from various backend services as a graph, facilitating data aggregation and retrieval.

tools.name: NOUS
tools.one_line_profile: System for construction, querying, and reasoning with Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: NOUS is a framework for building, querying, and performing reasoning on knowledge graphs, supporting streaming data and dynamic knowledge base construction.

tools.name: SuperPhy Semantic
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic web ontologies and tools for SuperPhy
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the semantic web components (ontologies, RDF generation tools) for the SuperPhy platform, enabling semantic modeling of pathogen genomic data.

tools.name: Spfy
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated graph database for E. coli phenotype prediction
tools.detailed_description: Spfy is an integrated graph database system designed for the real-time prediction of Escherichia coli phenotypes and downstream comparative genomic analyses using graph-based data structures.

tools.name: Tentris
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance disk-based RDF graph database
tools.detailed_description: Tentris is a tensor-based RDF triple store designed for high-performance graph analytics and querying on large datasets using disk-based storage.

tools.name: VocView
tools.one_line_profile: SKOS vocabulary viewer web application
tools.detailed_description: VocView is a web application for visualizing and browsing SKOS vocabularies and RDF taxonomies, supporting the management and dissemination of scientific terminologies.

tools.name: Trio
tools.one_line_profile: Datatype agnostic triple store & query engine API
tools.detailed_description: Trio is a datatype-agnostic triple store and query engine API designed for flexible graph data storage and retrieval, suitable for semantic web applications.

tools.name: Text2Cypher Llama Agent
tools.one_line_profile: Agents converting natural language to Cypher queries for Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A collection of LlamaIndex-powered agents that translate natural language questions into Cypher queries to retrieve information from Neo4j databases, facilitating accessible graph data analysis.

tools.name: Cognee
tools.one_line_profile: Memory and Knowledge Graph management for AI Agents
tools.detailed_description: Cognee provides a framework for creating and managing memory and knowledge graphs for AI agents, enabling structured data storage and retrieval for cognitive architectures.

tools.name: TrustGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge graph tool to eliminate AI hallucinations
tools.detailed_description: TrustGraph is a tool designed to construct and utilize knowledge graphs to ground AI agents, aiming to reduce hallucinations by providing structured, verifiable knowledge contexts.

tools.name: UStore
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance multi-modal database with graph capabilities
tools.detailed_description: UStore is a high-performance, multi-modal database system that supports graph data storage and provides interfaces for NetworkX and Pandas, designed for data science and AI applications.

tools.name: UrbanKGent
tools.one_line_profile: Urban knowledge graph construction agent
tools.detailed_description: UrbanKGent is an AI agent framework designed specifically for the construction of urban knowledge graphs, automating the extraction and structuring of urban data.

tools.name: Web-Karma
tools.one_line_profile: Information integration tool for semantic web data
tools.detailed_description: Karma is an information integration tool that enables users to map data from various sources (databases, spreadsheets, web APIs) to ontologies, facilitating the creation of linked data and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: HeroDB
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid RDBMS and Graph database engine
tools.detailed_description: HeroDB is a database engine that supports both relational and graph data models, providing storage and query capabilities for complex data structures.

tools.name: NebulaGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed, scalable graph database
tools.detailed_description: NebulaGraph is a distributed, high-performance open-source graph database designed for massive-scale graph data processing, featuring horizontal scalability and high availability.

tools.name: Nebula-Algorithm
tools.one_line_profile: Graph algorithms for NebulaGraph based on Spark GraphX
tools.detailed_description: Nebula-Algorithm is a library of graph algorithms (e.g., PageRank, Louvain) implemented on Spark GraphX that integrates with NebulaGraph for large-scale graph analysis.

tools.name: Nebula Exchange
tools.one_line_profile: Spark-based data import tool for NebulaGraph
tools.detailed_description: Nebula Exchange is a data integration tool based on Apache Spark that enables batch and streaming data import from various sources (Hive, MySQL, Neo4j, etc.) into NebulaGraph.

tools.name: NebulaGraph Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization and management tool for NebulaGraph
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for NebulaGraph that allows users to query, visualize, and explore graph data, facilitating the analysis of scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: triplestore
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight RDF triple store library for managing and querying semantic data
tools.detailed_description: A Go library to manage, query, and store RDF triples, supporting the construction and manipulation of semantic knowledge graphs.

tools.name: iBKH
tools.one_line_profile: Integrative Biomedical Knowledge Hub for biomedical data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package and platform providing access to a comprehensive biomedical knowledge graph, integrating data from multiple sources for biomedical reasoning and discovery.

tools.name: NebulaGraph Desktop
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop client for managing and visualizing NebulaGraph databases
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform desktop application for NebulaGraph, providing graph visualization and query capabilities for researchers managing local or remote knowledge graphs.

tools.name: NebulaGraph-NX
tools.one_line_profile: NetworkX adapter for NebulaGraph enabling scientific graph analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that allows users to use the NetworkX API to manipulate and analyze graphs stored in NebulaGraph, bridging database storage with scientific graph algorithms.

tools.name: jupyter_nebulagraph
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter notebook extension for NebulaGraph queries and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A tool enabling direct execution of nGQL queries and graph visualization within Jupyter Notebooks, integrating graph database operations into the scientific research workflow.

tools.name: nebula-dgl
tools.one_line_profile: Integration package for NebulaGraph and Deep Graph Library (DGL)
tools.detailed_description: A library that connects NebulaGraph with DGL, enabling researchers to perform deep learning on graphs (GNNs) using data stored in NebulaGraph.

tools.name: nebulagraph-ai
tools.one_line_profile: High-level API for graph algorithms and analytics on NebulaGraph
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing simplified interfaces for running graph algorithms and analytics on NebulaGraph, designed to facilitate AI-driven graph analysis.

tools.name: Wikidata Query Blazegraph
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database engine used by Wikidata for SPARQL queries
tools.detailed_description: The specific version and configuration of the Blazegraph graph database used to power Wikidata's query service, supporting massive-scale RDF storage and SPARQL querying.

tools.name: BioGrakn
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph-based semantic database for biomedical sciences
tools.detailed_description: A specialized configuration and schema for Grakn (TypeDB) designed to model and query biomedical data, facilitating semantic reasoning in biology.

tools.name: Yuxi-Know
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph Agent Platform integrating RAG and LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A platform combining Knowledge Graphs (Neo4j), RAG (LightRAG), and LLMs to build intelligent agents for knowledge retrieval and reasoning, applicable to scientific knowledge management.

tools.name: d3-sparql
tools.one_line_profile: Library to bridge SPARQL query results with D3.js visualization
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library that executes SPARQL queries and formats the results for use with D3.js, enabling the creation of data visualizations from semantic web data sources.

tools.name: zef
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for temporal graph-relational data management
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit and database layer for managing graph-relational data with support for time-travel and temporal queries, suitable for complex scientific data modeling.

tools.name: NL2GQL
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based tool for converting natural language to Graph Query Language
tools.detailed_description: A tool leveraging Large Language Models to translate natural language questions into Graph Query Language (GQL) for NebulaGraph or Neo4j, facilitating easier access to knowledge graphs.

tools.name: AdaKGC
tools.one_line_profile: Schema-adaptable Knowledge Graph Construction tool
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a schema-adaptable approach for Knowledge Graph Construction, allowing for flexible extraction of entities and relations based on changing schemas.

tools.name: AutoKG
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-driven Knowledge Graph Construction and Reasoning framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework utilizing Large Language Models for automated Knowledge Graph construction and reasoning, exploring the capabilities of LLMs in structured knowledge tasks.

tools.name: ContinueMKGC
tools.one_line_profile: Continual Multimodal Knowledge Graph Construction tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for continual learning in multimodal knowledge graph construction, enabling the system to adapt to new data modalities and tasks over time.

tools.name: DeepKE
tools.one_line_profile: Open toolkit for Knowledge Graph Extraction and Construction
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for knowledge graph extraction and construction, supporting standard supervised, low-resource, and document-level extraction scenarios.

tools.name: RAP
tools.one_line_profile: Schema-aware Reference as Prompt for Data-Efficient KG Construction
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing a schema-aware prompting strategy to improve data efficiency in Knowledge Graph construction using Large Language Models.

tools.name: AmpliGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Library for representation learning on knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for representation learning on knowledge graphs, capable of generating knowledge graph embeddings (KGE) for link prediction, knowledge discovery, and hypothesis generation in scientific datasets.

tools.name: GRAPE
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance graph representation learning library
tools.detailed_description: A Rust/Python library for graph representation learning, focusing on efficient graph processing, embedding generation, and link prediction evaluation, optimized for large-scale biological networks.

tools.name: FIORA
tools.one_line_profile: MS/MS spectrum prediction using graph neural networks
tools.detailed_description: An in silico fragmentation algorithm that uses graph neural networks to predict tandem mass spectra (MS/MS), bond cleavages, and retention times for small molecules, aiding in metabolomics and proteomics identification.

tools.name: flexynesis
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning suite for multi-omics data integration
tools.detailed_description: A deep-learning based multi-modal data integration framework designed to handle bulk and single-cell multi-omics datasets for dimensionality reduction, phenotype prediction, and biomarker discovery.

tools.name: OpenHGNN
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for heterogeneous graph neural networks
tools.detailed_description: An open-source toolkit based on DGL for heterogeneous graph neural networks (HGNNs), providing unified interfaces for running, evaluating, and developing various HGNN models for tasks like node classification and link prediction.

tools.name: ULTRA
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for inductive knowledge graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model for knowledge graph reasoning that generalizes to new graphs without retraining, supporting inductive link prediction and reasoning tasks.

tools.name: GraphVite
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance graph embedding system
tools.detailed_description: A general and high-performance graph embedding system designed for high-speed training of node embeddings on large-scale graphs and knowledge graphs, often used in bioinformatics for massive network analysis.

tools.name: BrainGB
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark and library for brain network analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library and benchmark for brain network analysis using graph neural networks, facilitating geometric deep learning on medical imaging data for neuroscience research.

tools.name: KG4SL
tools.one_line_profile: GNN-based model for synthetic lethality prediction in cancer drug discovery
tools.detailed_description: KG4SL is a graph neural network model that leverages knowledge graphs to predict synthetic lethality (SL) interactions, aiding in the discovery of anti-cancer drug targets.

tools.name: SpatialGlue
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning method for spatial multi-omics data integration
tools.detailed_description: SpatialGlue is a graph-based deep learning framework designed to integrate spatial multi-omics data, enabling more accurate interpretation of complex biological tissues.

tools.name: PeSTo
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning for protein binding interface prediction
tools.detailed_description: PeSTo (Protein Structure Transformer) is a geometric deep learning method that predicts protein binding interfaces directly from protein structures, useful for structural biology and drug design.

tools.name: DrugLAMP
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-modal LLM-based system for drug-target interaction prediction
tools.detailed_description: DrugLAMP utilizes multi-modal large language models to analyze structural affinities and predict drug-target interactions with high accuracy.

tools.name: DTiGEMSplus
tools.one_line_profile: Network-based tool for computational drug-target interaction prediction
tools.detailed_description: DTiGEMSplus is a computational tool that employs graph embedding, graph mining, and similarity-based techniques to predict drug-target interactions.

tools.name: EEG-DTI
tools.one_line_profile: Heterogeneous graph representation learning framework for DTI prediction
tools.detailed_description: EEG-DTI is an end-to-end heterogeneous graph representation learning-based framework designed for predicting drug-target interactions.

tools.name: LLMReasonCert
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation framework for Chain-of-Thought in multi-hop knowledge graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation for evaluating Chain-of-Thought (CoT) capabilities in multi-hop reasoning tasks over knowledge graphs, providing metrics and certification methods for reasoning paths.

tools.name: BGRL_Pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Bootstrapped Graph Latents (BGRL) for graph representation learning
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Large-Scale Representation Learning on Graphs via Bootstrapping, enabling self-supervised learning on graph structures without requiring negative sampling.

tools.name: EvoKG
tools.one_line_profile: Joint modeling of event time and network structure for temporal knowledge graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A framework for reasoning over temporal knowledge graphs that jointly models the timing of events and the evolving network structure to predict future interactions.

tools.name: OpenBG-IMG
tools.one_line_profile: Baseline models for multimodal product knowledge graph link prediction
tools.detailed_description: Provides baseline implementations and tools for the CCKS 2022 task on link prediction in multimodal product knowledge graphs, integrating image and text data.

tools.name: OpenBioLink
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation framework and dataset for biomedical link prediction
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive resource and evaluation framework designed for benchmarking link prediction models on heterogeneous biomedical graph data, ensuring high-quality benchmarks.

tools.name: SAFRAN
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable and fast non-redundant rule application for link prediction
tools.detailed_description: A C++ tool for efficient application of logical rules in large knowledge graphs to perform link prediction, focusing on scalability and speed.

tools.name: GAT
tools.one_line_profile: Reference implementation of Graph Attention Networks
tools.detailed_description: The original implementation of Graph Attention Networks (GATs), a novel neural network architecture that operates on graph-structured data, leveraging masked self-attentional layers.

tools.name: Edgeformers
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-empowered transformers for representation learning on textual-edge networks
tools.detailed_description: A framework that integrates graph structural information with transformer architectures to enhance representation learning on networks where edges contain rich textual information.

tools.name: GEANet-BioMed-Event-Extraction
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical event extraction using hierarchical knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A tool for extracting biomedical events from text by leveraging hierarchical knowledge graphs to capture complex relationships and dependencies.

tools.name: ChromeGCN
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Networks for DNA sequence classification
tools.detailed_description: Implements a graph neural network approach for classifying DNA sequences, modeling the sequences as graph structures to capture spatial and structural dependencies.

tools.name: CP-GNN
tools.one_line_profile: Context path-based GNN for community detection in heterogeneous graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Graph Neural Network model designed to detect communities in heterogeneous graphs by utilizing context paths to capture semantic relationships.

tools.name: ChatRule
tools.one_line_profile: Mining logical rules with LLMs for knowledge graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A framework that leverages Large Language Models to mine logical rules from knowledge graphs, enhancing reasoning capabilities in a cost-effective manner.

tools.name: graph-constrained-reasoning
tools.one_line_profile: Faithful reasoning on knowledge graphs with Large Language Models
tools.detailed_description: A method for constraining LLM reasoning processes using knowledge graph structures to ensure faithfulness and reduce hallucinations in multi-hop reasoning tasks.

tools.name: Reasoning on Graphs (RoG)
tools.one_line_profile: Faithful and interpretable LLM reasoning on graphs
tools.detailed_description: A framework that synergizes Large Language Models with Knowledge Graphs to perform faithful and interpretable reasoning, enabling the model to generate reasoning paths grounded in the graph.

tools.name: RTX-KG2
tools.one_line_profile: Build system for the RTX-KG2pre biomedical knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: The build system and workflow for constructing the RTX-KG2pre biomedical knowledge graph, which integrates data from multiple sources for the ARAX reasoning system.

tools.name: DKGR
tools.one_line_profile: Dual agent reinforcement learning for knowledge graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Learning to Walk with Dual Agents for Knowledge Graph Reasoning', using reinforcement learning to navigate knowledge graphs for reasoning tasks.

tools.name: BioBridge
tools.one_line_profile: Bridging biomedical foundation models via knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A method to align and bridge biomedical foundation models using knowledge graphs, enhancing their capability to understand and reason about biomedical concepts.
